intro: Monolepis spathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed monolepis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. Its leaves are lance-shaped and may have a subtle peppery scent, while its roots are fibrous and used in traditional medicine. Monolepis spathulata thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
